transportAdvice: Bergamo is well served by local buses connecting the lower city (Città Bassa) and the historic upper city (Città Alta), with a funicular railway making the steep climb between the two areas easy and enjoyable. The upper city is compact and best explored on foot, while taxis are readily available for longer journeys or airport transfers.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional frost, though heavy snowfall is infrequent; pack warm layers.
Still cold but days begin to lengthen slightly; occasional sunny spells break up overcast periods.
Temperatures begin to rise and spring hints appear, though rain showers are common throughout the month.
A pleasant but showery month as spring takes hold; light rain gear is advisable for sightseeing.
Warm and lush with frequent afternoon thunderstorms; one of the greener and more scenic times to visit.
Early summer brings warm, mostly sunny days with occasional thunderstorms; comfortable for outdoor exploration.
Hot and largely sunny, making it ideal for enjoying the upper city's terraces and outdoor dining.
Remains hot and dry though brief intense storms can occur; the city is quieter as locals head on holiday.
Warm and increasingly settled after summer, with pleasant temperatures and beautiful early autumn light.
Autumn arrives with cooler temperatures and more frequent rain; foliage in the surrounding hills is scenic.
Cool, damp and often foggy, particularly in the lower city; a quiet period with fewer tourists.
Cold and festive with Christmas markets adding charm; occasional frost and crisp clear days are possible.
